title.value: Medial Spectral Coordinates for 3D Shape Analysis
title.justification: The paper introduces a novel approach to 3D shape analysis called "Medial Spectral Coordinates".
title.quote: Medial Spectral Coordinates for 3D Shape Analysis

extractions.description: The paper proposes a novel method for 3D shape analysis that introduces medial spectral coordinates. This technique incorporates object width to enhance spectral representations, with applications in shape classification, part segmentation, and surface correspondence.

type.justification: The paper presents experiments and applications of their method in tasks such as object classification, segmentation, and correspondence finding, indicating it's empirical nature.
type.quote: We have proposed a novel spectral coordinate for 3D shape analysis applications, one that includes the local object width...Our experiments demonstrate the considerable benefits of doing this.

name.justification: The primary focus is on 3D shape analysis, which is a significant area within computer vision.
name.quote: 3D object shape analysis has received much attention due to its relevance to a variety of applications...In this context, 3D object shape analysis has received much attention due to its relevance to a variety of applications...

name.justification: The paper specifically deals with techniques for the analysis of 3D object shapes using spectral coordinates.
name.quote: In recent years there has been a resurgence of interest in our community in the shape analysis of 3D objects...

name.justification: PointNet is mentioned as a deep learning method that has shown promise in 3D shape classification.
name.quote: On this front, deep learning methods, including PointNet, PointNet++...

is_contributed.justification: PointNet is referenced, not contributed by this paper.
is_contributed.quote: PointNet: Deep learning on point sets for 3d classification and segmentation.

is_executed.justification: The paper does not specify if PointNet was executed as part of their experiments.
is_executed.quote: The added features result in an improvement in the overall accuracy of the model from 88.76% to 90.41% on ModelNet-10.

is_compared.justification: The paper compares their proposed method's performance with that of PointNet.
is_compared.quote: We tested the added features on the popular PointNet model. The added features result in an improvement...

referenced_paper_title.value: PointNet: Deep learning on point sets for 3d classification and segmentation
referenced_paper_title.justification: This is the title of the reference paper for PointNet, as mentioned in the discussions.
referenced_paper_title.quote: PointNet: Deep learning on point sets for 3d classification and segmentation.

name.justification: ModelNet10 is used for object classification experiments in the paper.
name.quote: The added features result in an improvement in the overall accuracy of the model from 88.76% to 90.41% on ModelNet-10.

referenced_paper_title.value: 3D shapenets: A deep representation for volumetric shapes
referenced_paper_title.justification: The dataset is described in relation to the Shapenets reference for understanding deep learning on volumetric shapes.
referenced_paper_title.quote: 3D shapenets: A deep representation for volumetric shapes.

name.justification: COSEG is used in reconstruction experiments and for evaluating segmentation tasks.
name.quote: A quantitative comparison via a mean intersection over union (mIoU) measure with original objects is shown in Table 1, over the entire datasets of ModelNet10 and COSEG.

referenced_paper_title.value: Active co-analysis of a set of shapes
referenced_paper_title.justification: The COSEG dataset is related to the active co-analysis technique discussed in the paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Active co-analysis of a set of shapes.
